website_summaries.verdict: Bank-grade security with a large display and an easy to use interface. Virus and malware protection built in.
pros: Supports Bitcoin, Ethereum, Litecoin, Namecoin, Dogecoin, Dash, and Testnet
cons: Requires the use of Google Chrome browser to work

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Stable, Safe
customer_reviews.text: This device is totally turnkey. Plug it in, update it, initialize it, and use it. Using with no issues across a PC and a MAC. Not much to it, but that is the beauty and elegance of it. I would be interested in an Android + OTG cable solution for portable use. UPDATE: The USB cable that comes with this is pretty nice - fabric covered. Mine went bad, and they quickly sent me two replacements via FedEx. So their support seems very responsive as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for  BTC, LTC and ETH - nothing else with native support. Sad.
customer_reviews.text: I used to use my KeepKey all the time, and it was great. Here's the skinny: If you trade / store in only BTC, LTC or Ethereum I would recommend the KeepKey without reservation. It's awesome. Problem is, I also store Monero, VEE, and Ripple. KeepKey does not support these coins, and doesn't appear to be heading in that direction. Sad to say, I've emptied my KeepKey and it now gathers dust.
customer_reviews.author: Charles W. Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Complicated and buggy
customer_reviews.text: Complicated I can deal with but recovering my KeepKey the software wants a 16 word phrase instead of my 12 word phrase. Well that s*cks especially with nobody there for online support. I would rather have a paper wallet than this piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: SHOPPER

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't have bought if I knew it required you use their exchange only! XLM/ETC Not supported
customer_reviews.text: The device doesn't work like a normal hardware wallet, it requires you use their site. So if they go out of business you are screwed. Also, they do not support ERC20 coins as advertised. At least not that I have seen. I use XLM and some other coins, and could not find a way to use them with the wallet. Also, the wallet itself just holds certs, and reads info off their site. When the price is too good to be true, there is a reason! ALSO, BREAKS GOOGLE VOICE IN CHROME!
customer_reviews.author: MattCurryCom

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in 2017, put some bitcoin on it.. Today decided to put some additional coins on it.. I've been sitting here, for at least, 20 minutes updating firmware.. Plug it in "holding the button", update, again, update, again, update, O computer restart required, (Not done yet), plug in, update, forgot to tell, also, they make to click a statement each time that also requires holding down the button on the device.. This is a joke.. I'll go through it to get my coins off this POS.. and throw this device in the trash.. Update.. I'm up to at least 25 firmware updates.. not done yet.. Gave up 1 hour in.. calling support later.. DON'T BUY THIS!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin L. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly good looking screen One button operation Support LTC/Doge coins
customer_reviews.text: Having used both Trezor and this h.w. wallets for quite a while, here are the pros and cons about this wallet I've found out: Pros: Pleasantly good looking screen One button operation Support LTC/Doge coins. Cons: Chrome extension is not as convenient as Trezor's webpage based interface, hard to keep wallet screen available.. Software is somewhat buggy, got a lot of "Encountered invalid prevhash" errors while sending doge. Update: Tech support/developer are very capable, they pushed out new versions and fixed the bug in a timely manner.
customer_reviews.author: JerryL

customer_reviews.title: Slick product, could use some testing in the ETH area
customer_reviews.text: Professional-quality product with a slick boxed appearance. Seems to come up as expected without problems in the Bitcoin space. Note that the interface (the Chrome app) is slightly buggy when adding an Ethereum account, however. It appeared to freeze. Having waited a full ten minutes, I decided to unplug/replug to find that the account was in fact created and apparently functional. Honestly, this should support browsers other than Chrome, however. You would think that iOS would be the customer's preferred platform for this, hence, Safari for the default interface rather than Chrome. There is room for growth by KeepKey but I'm still giving it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: This is WAY better than the Trezor.
customer_reviews.text: This is WAY better than the Trezor. The screen is large and readable, the Chrome plugin is nicer, the recovery process is very clever and more secure because you don't have to enter passwords on the computer. Works great with Multibit HD. Very easy to set up and use. If you want the tiniest bitcoin wallet for carrying in your pocket, maybe get the Trezor. But the KeepKey is more reliable, better designed, and easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: I am editing my review after KeepKey fixed severe problem
customer_reviews.text: KeepKey originally designed this device that could only be used with Chrome browser (which really sucks in terms of privacy and security). ShapeShift has now developed a non-Chrome standalone program to use it, and I LOVE it. This is now functioning better than I had ever hoped. I was ready to throw it away due to the horrible implementation, but now it's the best thing since sliced bread!!
customer_reviews.author: PWV

customer_reviews.title: ... out of order not working and customer support number waste of money it stuck on loading accounts since tow ...
customer_reviews.text: less than month and go out of order not working and customer support number waste of money it stuck on loading accounts since tow days I try to find solution in YouTube or google search but nothing found and I contact customer support never reply
customer_reviews.author: Dr Nizar

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware, software behind the competition
customer_reviews.text: I think I should have gotten the Ledger Nano S, as it gets more attention as its userbase is larger. The upcoming Trezor T has the same features as KeepKey, but has the power of the large Trezor userbase. The KeepKey works well enough, but with my first transactions with it the GUI had several bugs which made it seem I had lost some funds. It seems the new beta GUI fixes it. And they also gave me the money back due to that bug. I hope their development is able to keep up with that of Ledger and Trezor. The hardware and price is great, but the software really lags behind.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Lupton

customer_reviews.title: but the device support is very bad. Several months went by when they would not ...
customer_reviews.text: The device is high quality, but the device support is very bad. Several months went by when they would not deal with my questions regarding the splitting of Bitcoin and the support of any forked coins. There are much better options available. I moved all my BTC to another hardware wallet that is also available on Amazon. I would choose a hardware wallet with open source code that has a strong record of software updates, customer support and more company transparency. My Keepkey sits empty.
customer_reviews.author: Angry Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unusable 9 out of 10 times
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking hardware, but 9 out of 10 times stuck in "loading account" so you can't move any of the cryptocurrencies when you need it the most. Many people reported the same issue online w/o a resolution. Furthermore, the software doesn't support most Bitcoin splits or Ether airdrops, Even when it does occasionally, the release came out months late. All in all, stay away from this crappy product.
customer_reviews.author: C. Y.

customer_reviews.title: Lost 12 LTC due to an update and no recovery option.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible piece of equipment use it if you want to lose all your crypto assets. It constantly updates and entering your recovery password is not even an option. I personally lost 12 LTC as a result of this device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I was apprehensive to purchase this based on the low price. glad I did because it has been a very good crypto wallet experience. The shapeshift interface is seamless and simple to understand, setup was a breeze, and transfer of coins has gone smoothly. The box was not tampered with in any way, all of the keys are generated right on the wallet interface, and all coins are secureed with an easy to use pin code. Super happy!
customer_reviews.author: cframes1

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: Here's what happened: I attempted to transfer some Bitcoin Cash from one of the big exchanges to the KeepKey. The KeepKey did not accept the tokens, which are still hung up on the blockchain; they are not in the hardware wallet. When I contacted KeepKey support about the problem, we corresponded back and forth for a while, trying to find a solution. Then the correspondence stopped. When I opened a new support ticket, I got no response. Lousy product and support. I regret buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Woolery

customer_reviews.title: I just paid $130 USD for a scratched screen and what seems to be a used unit.
customer_reviews.text: I just received it 10 minutes ago (12/01/2017) and as I took out the unit from the box and the plastic from the front screen I noticed 2 large scratches. My wife just saw it and immediately said "It is used, return it"
customer_reviews.author: From the Oil Patch

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad investment if you have any BTC
customer_reviews.text: I am new to this whole bitcoin thing, but if BTC value remains high, I think it would be wise to put the bulk of your coin in a hardware wallet. The KK was easy to setup and transfer bits over. Just install a couple of Chrome plugins. I also can access the KK from Mycelium on my Android Turbo2 if I had to send funds without a PC. There is a beta plugin that also lets you transfer ETH coins too. That seems to work as well. People say the face scratches easily so I found an eyeglass case that it fits perfectly within.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Just received mine today and this is the condition it ...
customer_reviews.text: Just received mine today and this is the condition it came in. No faith that my funds won’t be compromised.
customer_reviews.author: william ferris

customer_reviews.title: A Real Pain in The Asterisk (u get what u pay 4)
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this for the price alone. Unfortunately unless you plan on using SHAPESHIFT exclusively you are gonna struggle and struggle. Today mine went in the trash. Spend the extra for a Trezor or a Ledger. Oh, and it didn't help that i discovered this was made in China. Would't have even bought it had i known. Caveat Emptor !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful wallet with great support
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product! Have used flawlessly for over a year. User interface screen is best on the market for budget hardware wallets. I had an issue that caused the keepkey to not connect to my computer after an upgrade. Contacted suppurt via email at 1am on a weekend and they got back to me in less than 30 mins and got me working again within two hours. 10/10 will buy again
customer_reviews.author: Roomguy

customer_reviews.title: Lack of versatility, buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: The GUI is great but guess what? I haven't actually used the damn thing. They need to release updates that support alt coins (or what they considered alt coins). Buyer beware if you are looking for a versatile wallet that supports a wide range of different currencies. Do your research. I will give it 2 stars though for its awesome GUI and large screen which most wallets do not have. Hopefully in the future they will send some updates to make this product awesome
customer_reviews.author: SecOps

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Almost entirely perfect. There's no way to do a "fully secure" 24 word seed, which I hope the development team will add soon. However, that's not so bad given that you can add an extra passphrase to your account. Otherwise it works exactly as intended. One other thing, the keepkey client software doesn't connect to your accounts while you have a vpn enabled in my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Wo0t

customer_reviews.title: 21st century banking in your hands
customer_reviews.text: Not only does this device do what it says but this is the first device that I think safely and securely puts the possession of my Bitcoin in my possession. If you're using a coinbase account I was even encouraged by one of their representatives to move my money under my control using one of these hard wallets. Innovation it seems is going to put more control and power into the hands of the individual. This is happening at the most opportune moment given the perverse practices of traditional banking.... 21st century banking is not banking it is services like coinbase and keep key
customer_reviews.author: Russpears

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware wallet - very pleased
customer_reviews.text: After installing proxy and extension in chrome, product worked exactly as advertised. The screen makes a big positive difference and its easy to use - very nice wallet. I was a little hesitant of moving coins out of bitcoin core on pc/mac into it at first, did some test, and always worked fine. Now we have it stored safely away and feel our coins are much more secure offline in cold storage. Definitely take this route if you look to use/invest in Bitcoin going forward. It is easy enough to move items on it or off as needed as well with pin.
customer_reviews.author: Travis W. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Almost got it all sorted.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I have a Ledger Nano S also and whilst that has more possible coins, the Keepkey is easier and has a better user interface. Only drawback is inability to set ‘gas’ setting when transferring ETH, leads to failed transactions when sending to an exchange (please change this), workaround is to leapfrog through Coinbase or another wallet.
customer_reviews.author: JRH

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS GARBAGE PRODUCT STOLE ALL MY BTC
customer_reviews.text: Complete garbage got my device wiped and couldent recover it as all the recovery sequences are 4 leters long looking for my 3 BITCOINS if the company acctully cares about their custumers they and im nk crying as i had about 15 thousnad dollars in bitcoin {FROM BANK LOANS} as a forceful update and i saved up 4 years to buy that
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: NO NOT BUY A KEEPKEY DEVICE IT IS GARBAGE !!!
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE A KEEPKEY DEVICE, PERIODICALLY YOU HAVE TO UPDATE THE SOFTWARE FROM THE COMPANY SITE, SO I DID THAT AND NOW A CAN NOT ACCESS MY CRYPTO STORED ON THE DEVICE. I'VE BEEN WORKING WITH DREW FROM KEEPKEY TECH SUPPORT FOR OVER A MONTH NOW AND ALL THEY DO IS JERK YOU AROUND AND SAY THEIR'S NOTHING THEY CAN DO ! SO IF YOU DON'T WANT TO DEAL WITH THIS PROBLEM I SUGGESTS YOU DO NOT BUY A KEEPKEY DEVICE !!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best bitcoin storage solution to date.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, simple and easy to use. My one tiny improvement suggestion would be the display, the number 1 and the letter l could be clearer. But for ease of use, confidence and security, 10/10. Best of all, outstanding customer service. I had a problem sending from my old wallet. The problem was with me and my old wallet, not really anything to do with the KeepKey, yet Erik answered all my questions, not short quick answers either but detailed clear information. My research indicated this is the one to get and my experience confirms it. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Charles P. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Best place to store your Crypto Coin.
customer_reviews.text: I never trusted a software wallet. Any thing that involves software can be hacked. With my KeepKey even if I lose it my Crypto Coin is still safe since I'm the only one that keeps the key to opening my wallet. KeepKey is hardware. Hack Proof.
customer_reviews.author: VCPG

customer_reviews.title: Revised review
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much turn key. Download the Chrome extension, throw some BTC on it, unplug, and forget. Cold storage made simple. Only down point is that you have to use Chrome. Most Mac people probably use Safari as default. I recommend this as long as you can justify the price. Revision...I bought this little over a month ago and now the price plummeted to $99 from $236??? Are you kidding me? The component cold stores bitcoins and sits in my safe. I want a refund or a discount! This is poor customer service. Revision 3/28/16...KeepKey was quick to respond to my ticket regarding the matter and made things right thus back up to 5 stars. Great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: PAUL GLUB

customer_reviews.title: Company gives every appearance of having stopped.
customer_reviews.text: I’d really like to be able to recommend this. The hardware and UI (on the device itself) are great. But the desktop software is outdated and terrible, support is nearly non-existent, and it really feels like development has stalled entirely. I’m not returning mine but I’m not using it either. I still have some hope that they’ll integrate with something like Exodus instead of pursuing their own lagging software. I wouldn’t suggest holding your breath though.
customer_reviews.author: Toholio

customer_reviews.title: Great. Easy to operate. But its videos do not cater for initial users of crypto currency or transferring from a paper wallet.
customer_reviews.text: It is effective in what it was designed to do ie be an offline wallet. It is easy to operate. My only difficulty, for which I had to go to Google to find out what to do, was transferring my bitcoin from my previously existing paper wallet to KeepKey. For initial users of Bitcoin/crypto currency you will have to do you own research of the mechanics of buying/selling/transferring as the KeepKey videos assume you know how to do that. Eg their video shows you the Keepkey side of things to receive/send bitcoin but does not show examples how you would send your bitcoin from another source to KeepKey.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Competitors are better
customer_reviews.text: Safely stores your bitcoin but does not provide the features needed to send BTC cheaply. You cannot change the fees. Also not much support for other currencies. Buy a Ledger Nano S or another wallet you like.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Robz

customer_reviews.title: Flawless Victory
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it in. Upgraded the Firmware. Wrote down the 12 word sentence. Installed Google App. Transferred bitcoins from CoinBase account. Paid for a gift card to test sending. All flawless!! A great product and now I feel my Bitcoins are secure.
customer_reviews.author: William Campbell

customer_reviews.title: I don't like or trust the new software
customer_reviews.text: When I finally got it, they stopped supporting the software I got to use it with. I don't like or trust the new software. Not super useful.
customer_reviews.author: Rootless

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, so easy to set up and use. Feel so safe having my coins off-line and secured. Interface is simple and clean. I have moved all my BTH and ETH to KeepKey and now sleep much better at night especially with the news of all the exchange hacks going on. Withdrawals cannot be made from my account unless the button on the side of the device is pushed. I look forward to the support of ZCash down the road
customer_reviews.author: JJJ

customer_reviews.title: Bitcoin Wallet Done Right!
customer_reviews.text: The keepkey bitcoin wallet does exactly what it's supposed to do. Portable and secure, this wallet keeps your bitcoin safe from getting stolen or hacked. The setup is quick and easy, and you get a recovery sentence just in case things go wrong. It works as advertised, the only downside is the consumer has to use an extension that only works on chrome. I would love to see some sort of desktop application or app so it doesn't have to depend on something like chrome to allow it to function.
customer_reviews.author: soor sany

customer_reviews.title: Uncertain of Advantages
customer_reviews.text: This item has to be paired or installed with the ShapeShift platform. I wasn't aware at time of purchase that I couldn't use it as a standalone device. I will have to update this review after I see if the ShapeShift platform adds value or if it just gets in the way...
customer_reviews.author: Chryssy67

customer_reviews.title: Dont Buy ! No Customer Service - Do Not Store Your Crypto On This Device
customer_reviews.text: I bought a keepkey 2 years ago. I was holding luckily a small amount of crypto in this device. Did not use for 6 months. Turned on and said I had to update firmware. After following all instructions and finalizing Keepkey would not turn on again. Contacted Keepkeys supposed award winning customer service 2 times. No reply for over two weeks now. Basically now would have to buy a new one to get back crypto. They say it is compliant and can download to other wallets but no instructions anywhere and seems can only do for Bitcoin so if have Ethereum or Litecoin or other cryptos you are out of luck. Just a scam ! Dont Buy !
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Carson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold all crypto but does have alot.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a hardware wallet and everyone wants to much for the ledger nano or they just don't keep up with stock so decided to try the keep key as it was on sale. Arrived unharmed and sealed. Easy to setup and use. Has wallets for almost all the crypto I use and or hodl. Keep key keeps adding new crypto wallets and features so maybe one day it'll be able to hold all erc20 tokens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish it supported more currencies like Zcash
customer_reviews.text: I would give it a 5 star rating, but it doesn't support Zcash which is far more prevalent than Litecoin or Dogecoin. Other than that, I like it and just wish it had bluetooth functionality because the cable seems cheap and prone to damage.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie E.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, so-so software interface
customer_reviews.text: Keepkey is an excellent quality product. It is very attractive and very clear to read. The only concern I have it that you have to have a chrome extension on your chrome browser to use. This extension is exceptionally barebones. Having extensions for other browsers or even better, a stand alone app would make me feel better that I will always be able to use it in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Moore

customer_reviews.title: Missing items, but great customer service resolved it.
customer_reviews.text: The USB cord wasn't included, but customer service promptly mailed me two which exceeded expectations. Overall the product is super easy to use with the Chrome extension, it was basically plug-and-play. I like these hard wallets because it makes me feel safe knowing I get nothing is connecting to my wallet. Compared to peers (which I do not own) KeepKey seemed like the best choice because most aesthetically pleasing, and watching comparison videos on youtube it seemed like the best of the three (others being Trezor and Ledger)
customer_reviews.author: Anthony945

customer_reviews.title: I like the device
customer_reviews.text: I like the device. I think it is perfectly designed. Unfortunately, I don't like the chrome extension. The competitor is doing better on that front. The have charts, send max (minus) fees, balance to fiat currencies etc.
customer_reviews.author: Marquis de Brooklyn

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Works well. Needs more currencies.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use if you aren't an idiot. Haven't had any problems with it. Wish it supported more currencies but I am sure that will come with time. I sleep better knowing my cryptos are on this rather than an exchange. Might be a tad overpriced. Not sure what it costs to make one.
customer_reviews.author: Gus

customer_reviews.title: Safe Cold Storage; Plug and Play Crypto Currency Wallet.
customer_reviews.text: Plug and play digital currency wallet. Take your Bitcoin/Ethereum whatever onto cold storage and sleep easy knowing Coinbase/Gemini won't lose your investment over night. Someone steal the physical keep key? Use recovery sequence and restore your wealth. Especially important given Bitcoin will (by my prediction) reach $2000 by end of 2017.
customer_reviews.author: Guinness

customer_reviews.title: Overall it is a great product and much safer than a software wallet
customer_reviews.text: Unit works well. It feels well made. Set up was a breeze. The only draw back is that it does not link directly with mobil devices. However this is not a huge inconvenience because you can simply take a screen capture of the QR Code from Chrome, transfer that picture to your phone and use that for all of you BTC purchases..That means there is no need for a software wallet on the phone. It is unfortunate that it is browser dependent (Chrome), but that seems to be a necessary evil. Overall it is a great product and much safer than a software wallet.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Possibly the worst wallet of the lot in terms of actual functionality. No support for any of the major alts. I can't set custom fees for a bitcoin transaction, and so is useless even if you use it for just storing and transferring BTC. Do yourself a favor and get a ledger nano s or a trezor.
customer_reviews.author: bookamp

customer_reviews.title: Joke
customer_reviews.text: Would have been good but it’s barely supported by any websites. The is not really any user checks I got a ledger nano s and it works millions better. Most sights support ledger and trezor
customer_reviews.author: lukas hines

customer_reviews.title: This is my go to bitcoin wallet. It is ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to bitcoin wallet. It is much more secure to keep your BTC in your pocket than to store it with providers... REMEMBER MT. GOX. I know too many people who could have avoided that situation by storing their BitCoin offline in this device. It's a solid build in an attractive case. It works well and is controlled by your web browser through an extension.
customer_reviews.author: A Stain on the Details

customer_reviews.title: Sleek cold storage.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Ethereum is supported too. As a newbie, I was able to get it all working quickly. Well done. I found that the keepkey chrome app had a bug though where it briefly would not show all my accounts. A restart of the chrome app resolved the issue.
customer_reviews.author: D. F.

customer_reviews.title: Questions about security.
customer_reviews.text: Note to buyers, only works with Google Chrome which CIA has indicated was/is compromised as per Wikileaks therefore uncertain of the security of the device. Would like to hear from vendor what measures are being taken to ensure security and integrity of their product.
customer_reviews.author: RedCanoe

customer_reviews.title: Great for bitcoin, still needs ethereum support
customer_reviews.text: The device is nice. The procedure is really easy to create a private key, and back it up. Doing it was reliable and I have confidence that even if the device breaks, I can get another one, and restore it with my same master wallet. They event sent a nice card and leather sleeve for paper backup and recovery. I got this because it was supposed to deal with Ethereum wallets, but as of Jan 11, 2017, it does not actually support Ethereum, outside of beta channels, which feels like a bait and switch.
customer_reviews.author: Nikolas Roby

customer_reviews.title: Not the best design
customer_reviews.text: After I bought this Keepkey, it didn't take long to realized that it was a mistake, I've been through a lot of troubles trying to log on Keepkey Client and also Shapeshift. (The two dashboard supposedly optimized for that wallet). I now, have two Ledger nano X and going to buy a third one.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisChenUSA

customer_reviews.title: The interface is extremely easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what I want it to do. The interface is extremely easy to use. I like that it integrates with Mycelium on my phone so that I can use it while on the road. The only thing that I don't like about it is that it doesn't have wide integration with a lot of wallets.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: First, it has some scratches on the keepkey, it seems it is an used item. Second, I follow the instructions and could not initiate the keepkey, and the keepkey app client asked me to update the firmware and confirmed I have recorded my secret code. However, I did not have the code. I suppose it was an used one. And I have no idea how I can use it!
customer_reviews.author: Albert T.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product
customer_reviews.text: A great little piece of technology. Couldn't be easier to use. Instructions are very clear. Chrome extension very straightforward. Hardware build quality is top notch. Definitely would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY  -  Get a Ledger
customer_reviews.text: After being purchased by shapeshift this product has gone to crap - do not buy this device - its not reliable and become a paper weight- i wouldn't trust my crypto on it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple: very user friebdly
customer_reviews.text: The Keep Key is awesome. I have multiple wallets but none feel as safe as Keep Key. Add coin and then cold store it. My coin is much safer and it only took a few minutes of searching on Amazon. I do use my phone quite a bit and a phone connection would be great.
customer_reviews.author: J8ked

customer_reviews.title: I wish it had a pop out usb connector, ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish it had a pop out usb connector, but I understand why they kept it a simple design. Still though works exactly as expected except for one minor issue. The internal shapeshift conversion from one currency to another works some of the time, not all of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Daween

customer_reviews.title: The key is simple to use and a sturdy product. However it should hold far more coins
customer_reviews.text: The key is simple to use and a sturdy product. However it should hold far more coins. It should at the very least hold Ethereum E20 coins. The Ledger nano can hold a lot more. I'll jeep the Keep Key and buy the nano as well.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Hinds

customer_reviews.title: Limited. But excellent
customer_reviews.text: Keepkey is a must for all serious offline keepers of bitcoin and altcoins. BuT. ........ is very limited on the number of cryptos you can add... only about 8. Only wish they would add more. Doesn't seem so difficult but when emailing them they said in the future. I personally don't like keeping my alts on an exchange or in numerous wallets. Keep key makes it simple and safe... Come on keepkey. There's 500 cryptos. Lets have a choice of all alts in the add account section...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to see and use
customer_reviews.text: The only Down side of this wallet is it does not store XRP at the time of this review. It is was easy to set up and I LIKE THE LARGE screen. So over all minus 1 star for not supporting XRP
customer_reviews.author: Free American SpiritTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Such good potential in this product
customer_reviews.text: Such good potential in this product. However from my experience the development side is lacking. If they roll out updates and support for additional coins, I will revise my rating.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: I don't like the fact that you can not manually change the ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the fact that you can not manually change the transaction fee.... the fee defaults to some amount that is a bit higher than i would like....
customer_reviews.author: Alana

customer_reviews.title: Keepkey is not for dummies
customer_reviews.text: There have been 3 of us trying to figure this thing out. There are no instructions and finding help online is frustrating and time consuming. It makes me wonder if I'll be able to get bitcoin off it once I get it in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: There have been very few new features added compared to the competitors in this market. In addition the TX fees are not adjustable so you pay whatever they are set at, which can be very expensive. There was a long period where the software did not function at all for me and a number of other people with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Boris

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised, maybe a bit overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: Small and easy to use. Have to download two chrome plugins, then you just plug it in, enter your password and it's that easy. Seems to work really well, haven't had a problem with it. For spending $100 I thought it would have been made a tad bit better, but it certainly does the job. I'm glad I got it. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: White1ce

customer_reviews.title: I can sleep easy now!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best purchases I've made on amazon. I've been a victim of attack before, and ever since I've been rather paranoid about my coins in my on-computer wallets, such as mist or electrum. I turned to paper wallets afterwards, but they are incredibly inconvenient. After getting my hands on this, I can finally be at peace knowing my coins are at a cold storage that can be easily accessible in about 10 seconds. Super sleek device.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Jo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hardware wallet
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, safe hardware wallet. I don’t really get so much negativity from some. I will admit GUI could be better but that is not why I buy a hardware wallet. iPhone integration is still pending though and would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: alegoje

customer_reviews.title: Totally safe offline storage for Bitcoin and Etherium
customer_reviews.text: An amazing little device, KeepKey works seamlessly through it's Chrome extension and allows even a novice like me to easily buy, transfer and securely store Bitcoin and Etherium. Because it is stored offline, my digital currencies are completely safe from hackers.The KeepKey device is like your own portable and fully encrypted bank vault. Even if you lose it (highly unlikely) or it is stolen, it is easy to restore all of your digital savings. This is a really good product.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: An excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the KeepKey in order to facilitate purchasing bitcoin without wanting to rely on an online wallet. The Keepkey has been extremely easy to use, the set up directions are perfect and all in all its everything I had hoped for. My only gripe would be that (in my own self-acknowledged laziness), I wish it was easier to use in regards to some of the other cryptocurrencies out there. As far as Bitcoin goes its flawless so far!
customer_reviews.author: Sum_Randum_guy

customer_reviews.title: KeepKey
customer_reviews.text: I am still a newbie to crypto-currency but have moved from my online wallet to my first hardware wallet and really like KeepKey it allows you to make accounts for several different cryptos and lets you exchange them with each other all in one place.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Y.

customer_reviews.title: Don't use the USB cable that comes in the box
customer_reviews.text: The usb cable that comes with it is junk. The firmware update was taking forever. I threw away the cable that came with it and used one from one of my cell phones. No problems after that. Works as described.
customer_reviews.author: Customer and Reader

customer_reviews.title: It had to be the KeepKey
customer_reviews.text: I spent some time deliberating between the KeepKey and Trezor, ultimately deciding on the KeepKey. The Trezor requires 24 recovery words for their passphrase in order to achieve maximum security, while KeepKey only requires 12 for optimal (and arguably stronger) security. This was the real selling feature for me, as I wanted to be able to memorize my passphrase rather than worry about getting access to my written backup or misplacing it. I was also planning on keeping a few wallets. So that's 12 or 24 passwords for each wallet depending on which device I choose. Memorizing 12...doable. Memorizing 24...that would be a problem. So it had to be the KeepKey.
customer_reviews.author: exoticflower

customer_reviews.title: Needs better support for more altcoins
customer_reviews.text: Probably the easiest hardware wallet you could use. I love the screen on it and it is very simple to use. So why the 4 stars? I wish that for the price of this item it supported more currencies. I know they are adding more all the time, but it seems to be a little slow for my liking.
customer_reviews.author: Geraine

customer_reviews.title: The box was sealed like it normally would look if bought new
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived “used” when I paid for “new”. The box was sealed like it normally would look if bought new, but when I opened it the KeepKey itself had scuff marks on the screen and there wasn’t any plastic covering the screen like there should have been. Other than that it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully, they will add more coins support
customer_reviews.text: The wallet itself, is the best. Material is great, very easy to use and user interface is clean and fast. However, if you want to store some coins like eos, xrp, xlm, tron, zec, xmr, etc or other altcoins, you should look others.
customer_reviews.author: Harman Swoken

customer_reviews.title: Awesome device, but there's room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: The device delivers as promise hands down, but with one drawback: It only stores the most high-value popular coins and nothing in the way of storing lower value coins. Other than that, the device is solid.
customer_reviews.author: Spicy78

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent BTC HD wallet to store your bitcoins, the built in shapeshift exchange makes it alot easier to transfer to other coins that this wallet can do. Other supported coins are LTC, ETH, DOGE & DASH. To sum it up it's the most simple wallet out there with top notch security features.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and use
customer_reviews.text: Solid feel, beutiful design. Easy to setup and use. So far I've thourouhgly enjoyed this hardware wallet. Keep in mind I only have ethereum and no other ERC20 tokens. I also do worry about how forks are handled with coins stored in this wallet so this rating may change if i run into issues down he road.
customer_reviews.author: jacob uselton

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: Trouble with the website the whole system support is no help pretty much lost $500 using this thing cuz you have to use to shape-shift web site that doesn't work half the time. transactions fail, once you purchase Bitcoin onto the device you can't transfer it out anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher P.

customer_reviews.title: Buy it and they force you upon another platform
customer_reviews.text: They want you to use their partner to buy trade and sell your crypto. They don't make it easy to just transfer from another like coinbase. Waste of my money. I dont like buying an item just for them to try and sell me another. I will probably strap this device to a bottle rocket come july 4th
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Best option for a hardware wallet
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use, well built and secure. The encrypted pin pad on the screen which is randomized each time ensures only the person with the pin can access the wallet. Sending and receiving is extremely simple and if you lose the wallet entirely you can just get another, enter the recovery sequence and there's all your coin back again. Brilliant! If only everything with bitcoin was this simple...
customer_reviews.author: Toby C.

customer_reviews.title: it doesn't hold a charge you have to keep it attached to your pc in order to turn it on
customer_reviews.text: It's extremely fragile the screen of mine cracked and you cannot use it unless you connect it with a computer for it to turn on and even view your money it was not what i hoped for..
customer_reviews.author: Corrine Rukia Yeverino

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to use and install and now I am all set for bitcoins.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio luis

customer_reviews.title: Really good wallet
customer_reviews.text: The device i really good built, but the software has some bugs.
customer_reviews.author: Marjian88

customer_reviews.title: it really works but you have to pay someone and ...
customer_reviews.text: it really works but you have to pay someone and pay someone else just to transfer the bit coins to this device. So think twice when getting bitcoin. try to keep it in one spot so there are not many people picking your bitcoin pocket
customer_reviews.author: melody stuart

customer_reviews.title: I liked Ledger Nano S better than this
customer_reviews.text: Very few coins storage is compatable with this. I liked Ledger Nano S better than this one
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Safe, Effective, and Simple Device
customer_reviews.text: With some careful study and after watching some You Tube videos I became more comfortable with my KeepKey. After buying some coins on Coinbase I tested out the sending of bitcoin as well as the key points very slowly to be sure of myself. Now I am very happy to store several different cypto's and feel my investments are safe and secure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: $1200 brick. Don't trust it more than 12 months.
customer_reviews.text: This device lasted amost exactly year before resetting itself and going blank. When I attempt the recovery process, the mnemonic doesn't work and the device will sometimes power off in the middle of recovery. I now have one bitcoin stuck on this garbage device. Thanks for nothing keepkey.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!
customer_reviews.text: A very useful wallet. It only support bitcoin, Litecoin, dogecoin, Dash, and other one that I don’t remember. Very simple to install and use it. A very safe way to keep you criptos. I’ve been using it for 3 months and I’m very glad with it.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique Gutz

customer_reviews.title: Best hardware around
customer_reviews.text: Best hardware around, even has great software, IF it would support some reasonable alt coins. Basically only buy this if bitcoin is the only thing you're going to need and even then, I'd say there are better alternatives. Such a shame for such a great looking product and the way the interface works is awesome too. Really such a shame. Software is years out of date.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic little device. Even comes with quick exchange services if you are so inclined. Would Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: T. M. Bentley

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: Had problems @ first. Keep key customer service made it right. Everything is working perfect. I love this product!! 5 stars on everything especially the customer service the best I have ever dealt with.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great for BTC & multibit ...
customer_reviews.text: First of all KeepKey appears to work great with Mutitbit, which KeepKey recently purchased. If all you'll need to do is store bitcoins you'll be more than satisfied.... Edit: Darin at KeepKey support fixed the electrum-ltc issues I mentioned previously, so since they no longer apply I deleted them and raised the rating to 5 stars. It's a real nice product, and works with electrum-ltc now, LTC chrome wallet is coming soon, so I am told thx
customer_reviews.author: TXSteve

customer_reviews.title: I would like to see my balance in USD
customer_reviews.text: 5 Stars, No Option! ***** To the developers: PLEASE, ADD MORE CRYPTO-CURRENCY wallets. Аlso, I would like to see my balance in USD, EUR, CAD.... I will buy Keep Key 2.0 Even for 300, or 400 USD!
customer_reviews.author: TARAS DEMKIV

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: What's not to hate? KeepKey dongle never moved past displaying KeepKey. Windows Detected it Chrome did not. After twenty minutes of research I find many others who have had similar issues. Don't waste your time or money.
customer_reviews.author: Donald S Johnston

customer_reviews.title: I like the security of my KeepKey but it doesn't support ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the security of my KeepKey but it doesn't support a lot of the coins I own. They need to add Decred - the best crypto currently available.
customer_reviews.author: Devin the Dude

product_meta.title: KeepKey - The Simple Cryptocurrency Hardware Wallet
feature_bullets: Bank-Grade Security that is Simple: KeepKey is the most secure bitcoin wallet available. It makes best-practice bitcoin security easy so that even your grandmother can protect her bitcoin wealth.

Backup and Recovery: During initialization, you are given the one-time opportunity to write down a backup of your KeepKey in the form of a twelve-word recovery sentence. If your KeepKey is lost or stolen, you can safely recover your device and its bitcoins without compromising the security of your private keys.

Virus and Malware Proof: Because KeepKey does not have an operating system, the layers that viruses, malware, and key loggers infect do not exist on the device. Using KeepKey gives you confidence that hackers can't get to your bitcoins.
Multi-Currency Support: KeepKey not only supports Bitcoin, but also Ethereum, Litecoin, Namecoin, Dogecoin, Dash, and Testnet.

Works on PC, Mac, Linux, and Android: KeepKey is a USB HID-class device. That means, like a typical mouse or keyboard, drivers are not required. Plug in the provided premium USB cable, and your device just works: immediately giving you the highest level of bitcoin security.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars546 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
